definitions: To strike (someone or something) with a whip or stick.
To beat (something) with a whip or stick.
To move or strike forcefully or rapidly.
To tie or fasten (something) securely with a rope or cord.
examples: The rider would lash the horse to make it go faster.
Waves began to lash against the shore.
He watched the cat lash its tail.
They had to lash the cargo down before the storm.
